text: it would need to be known in the system that the url was for the chart api so it would be handled right. I think the urls for the media would need to have some kind of qualifier attached, image, chart, video, whatever. so they load into the right template for display. But they would certainly be available to either parent or child objects in the data. dont think that part has any bearing. The any animation would fire upon display of that chart on the screen. or if the data was changed. The animations themselves are fairly prescribed, being a set style for each chart, but looks like you can change things like time length and ease. There are lots of options for customizing the charts it looks like, on a per chart basis. Looking at bar charts for example there is a whole section on them being more material, <https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/gallery/barchart#creating-material-bar-charts>
then looking at pie chart, i dont see any animation options at all. I dont think the pie charts are animated

looks like if you look at their overview <https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/gallery> you can see the type of charts there are, and the ones that do animate are set to here, they are swaping a data set back and forth to cause an animation update
Easy place to find screen dimensions and orientation <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1jg3ebDNf4B1sx2sK_EQ8-yd-lCSuF-DZA2ynlvioe2U/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F3MBC2CRG/net_contributor_exhibit_screen_details|Net Contributor Exhibit Screen Details>
